summary: This bill, the 'Strong Sentences for Safer D.C. Streets Act,' aims to increase mandatory minimum sentences for various crimes in the District of Columbia. It specifically addresses first and second-degree murder, rape, first-degree sexual abuse, kidnapping, carjacking, and first-degree burglary. The bill specifies the minimum sentences and, in some cases, eliminates or amends existing provisions related to sentencing. The changes apply to individuals charged on or after the bill's enactment.
